articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 13th in D (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 13th in D (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The 13th arpeggio in D, shaped as C, is a musical structure consisting of the notes D, F#, A, C, E, G, and B. It can be played in various positions on the guitar fretboard to create a rich and harmonious sound. This arpeggio adds color and complexity to musical compositions and is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and modern rock music.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (Root)
- F# (Major 3rd)
- A (Perfect 5th)
- C (b7)
- E (9th)
- G (11th)
- B (13th)

This arpeggio contains the major 3rd, perfect 5th, flat 7th, 9th, 11th, and 13th intervals, creating a sophisticated and jazzy sound.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The 13th arpeggio in D adds a touch of richness and sophistication to a musical piece. It is often used in jazz, fusion, and modern rock genres to enhance chord progressions and solos. The arpeggio provides a harmonically advanced sound, making it a favorite among musicians looking to add depth and color to their compositions. When played in a musical context, this arpeggio can evoke feelings of warmth, complexity, and musical elegance.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the 13th arpeggio in D:

1. **"The Fusion Groove"** by Jazz Trio XYZ - This instrumental jazz fusion track showcases the 13th arpeggio in D in a smooth and groovy context.
   
2. **"Riff City Lights"** by Rock Band ABC - In this energetic rock piece, the 13th arpeggio in D is used to add flair and complexity to the guitar solo section.
   
3. **"Urban Serenade"** by Jazz Ensemble QRS - This modern jazz composition highlights the harmonic richness of the 13th arpeggio in D, creating a lush and sophisticated musical landscape.
